result.execSummary:
The defendant Adriana M Carvalho was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Adriana M Carvalho in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Susan L Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State.  

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 

5Years 6 months months Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )  CONSECUTIVE TO 12CF70
- 3 Years 6 months of Initial Confinement
- 2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years  CONSECUTIVE TO 12CF70

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with Subway on Silvernail in Waukesha and  Mohinder G..
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

Restitution: $200.00  (to be paid during the first 12 months of probation )

Costs: $ 278.00
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00
(To to be paid during the first 24 months of probation)

Condition Time: 6 Months NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - Stayed and to be used at the agent's discretion.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Atty. Smith requests the court grant expunction.  Court denies as it is not in the public interest.

Defendant Adriana M Carvalho in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is on a probation hold and will be waiving revocation.  Atty. Smith is requesting a date to see the status of the other case.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Adriana M Carvalho in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Attorney Joseph Smith, Jr. for defendant.
Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
